About us

Led by the team from Learning Sciences International (LSI), “Instructional Empowerment” means that all students, teachers, and leaders thrive in a rigorous learning environment that builds agency through providing opportunities to exercise autonomy, develop self-regulation, and support critical thinking. IE’s Partnership Promise: • We meet you where you are, learn your current initiatives, and focus on YOUR instructional vision, initiatives, and goals for improvement. • We walk your schools with you, we own your data with you, and we work side-by-side with you. • We hold ourselves accountable because we are in this together and invested in your overall outcome. • We build effective teams and strengthen leadership, teachers, and students to achieve their compelling purpose. • We work together with leaders and teachers to strengthen core instructional systems and practices to improve outcomes for ALL students. IE will bring you the same instructional expertise we brought you at Learning Sciences International, backed by the same research that our team has developed over the course of 20+ years of working with schools across the country. We will bring you the same evidence-based systems approach to school improvement. We believe true empowerment is achieved when systems and structures align to ensure students engage in rigorous, standards-based tasks that build knowledge with peers in collaborative, interdependent teams. The same award-winning faculty from LSI is transitioning to IE. We are educators who have sat in your seats as former teachers, principals, and leaders and we are excited to continue working shoulder-to-shoulder with you. Research is at the heart of our work. Our partnerships with world-class researchers like Dr. Robert J. Marzano and Dr. Ruth Wageman have transitioned with us to IE. If you believe what we believe, we hope you’ll join us to make the teaching and learning process more empowering for every child and educator.

    Thank you to Arizona Department of Education for inviting Expert Educators, Michelle Fitzgerald, Ed.D. and Kim S. Harris, to present Instructional Empowerment’s transformative methods at the prestigious Elevate leadership program. Organized by the Department of Education’s School Support and Improvement Unit, Elevate gathers school leaders across the state to explore cutting-edge, research-based approaches to systems-level improvement.  Fitzgerald and Harris shared Instructional Empowerment's empowering framework, which provides districts with tools to dramatically boost learning.

    We’re thrilled to welcome our newest School Leadership Coaches to the Instructional Empowerment team! Their experience and expertise will be invaluable assets as they join us on our social mission to end generational poverty and eliminate racial achievement gaps through transformed core instruction. Please help give a warm welcome to Clarita Thompson, M. Ed., Marquita McCullum, M.Ed., Natalie Dhanoolal Rubio, and Ashley Baez. Their passion for education and commitment to student success already shines through. We can't wait to see the positive impact they'll have on our partner school communities.  Thank you to Kim S. Harris (pictured here) and Jody Honaker and Lindsay Elliott (not pictured) for their work supporting our new faculty!  Join us in congratulating them on this exciting new chapter!

    We are excited to announce that renowned poet and author Nikki Giovanni will deliver the closing keynote address titled "Diversity as Art: Art is Diversity" at the 13th Annual Building Expertise Educators' Conference at Disney's Coronado Springs Resort from June 19-21, 2024.   Giovanni has written over 30 volumes of poetry and prose, including children's books like “Rosa” which received the prestigious Caldecott Medal. She is the recipient of numerous honors including Woman of the Year awards from Ebony and Mademoiselle magazines.   Join us at #BE2024 to hear this literary legend’s inspiring message. 📢Be the first to find out 2024 keynotes, weigh in on session topics, and get exclusive conference insights: https://hubs.la/Q021MxFw0 💭Let us know in the comments if you're looking forward to hearing Nikki Giovanni speak! #LearningandDevelopment #EducationalLeadership

    Each school has unique needs and goals on their Pathway to Advancement. We offer three pathways with varying levels of support to help you reach your vision for students, no matter your starting point. 📕 The Emerge Pathway gives intensive support to significantly improve achievement.   📘 The Elevate Pathway helps schools with fluctuating scores reach the next level.  📙 The Enhance Pathway continues improving outcomes for high-achieving schools. We’re here to help you on your journey toward empowerment because we know you want every student to thrive. 👉Learn more about your Pathway to Advancement: https://hubs.la/Q021MxdP0 #StudentSuccess #Education

  • Instructional Empowerment reposted this

    Michael D. Toth

    Education Author | Speaker | Thought Leader | Superintendent Coach | Founder and CEO of Instructional Empowerment

    3w
    • Report this post

    Two amazing days with Superintendent Dr. Tawana Grover and the entire Cedar Rapids Community School District central office instructional leadership team. On Day 1, we worked on further establishing the district’s Destination Vision for Instruction that is grounded in a powerful Why vision. On Day 2, we visited Cedar Rapids schools and used the classroom walkthrough tool developed by our Applied Research Center. The tool measures the effectiveness of instructional systems in schools and is research-proven to predict student outcomes. The schools were very welcoming of the walking teams. Dr. Grover and her team are exceptional. It was an honor to spend quality time becoming grounded in the vision for the work. I am particularly grateful for the feedback from the leaders on how grounding and powerful the time was together. This was part of Instructional Empowerment's Leading to Your Why Workshop series for executive leaders. Thank you, Cedar Rapid team, for inviting us on your journey as you bring your district to the next level!
